thread.title: Martin Lewis has awkward interview with Kate Garraway
thread.title_full: Martin Lewis has awkward interview with Kate Garraway

title: Martin Lewis has awkward interview with Kate Garraway
text: Buy now Clearly irked: Money Saving Expert Martin said: 'I'm just moving on and ignoring you both, which is what I tend to do usually anyway' Hilarious: Kate didn't seem to be able to stop her giggles as she tried to carry on with the interview The presenter struggled to keep her eyes open after opting to wear false eyelashes. Elsewhere her heavily applied foundation and what appeared to be an unfortunate lipstick stain on her faux fur collar became sources of amusement among fans. Just before Christmas she also got tongues wagging after viewers accused her of being 'drunk' on air. The 49-year-old spilled a glass of water which she went on to mop up with her production notes while sitting behind the desk alongside fellow presenters Ben Shepherd and Ranvir Singh. Kate previously caused a stir among viewers with her make-up 'fail' during her coverage of Donald Trump's inauguration, pictured And viewers accused her of being 'drunk' on air during a show before last Christmas, pictured Last October she was forced to clarify comments about former Girls Aloud singer Cheryl after she appeared to mock her weight. She told MailOnline that she was 'mortified' her remarks have been misinterpreted. Cheryl was seen stood with her Liam Payne prompting Kate to joke: 'She’s really ballooned. That’s what counts as putting on weight in Cheryl’s world.' It was later revealed the singer was pregnant. Meanwhile. Richard got shirty with Kate yesterday while talking about Robbie Williams, who is set to appear on Let It Shine. He said: 'Not only will he be joining his old bandmates for a sing-song, he will be joining them as a guest judge.' Having a giggle: Meanwhile, Kate had Ranvir in hysterics on the show with her hair disaster as her style was backcombed Tut tut: She was also caught out having a cheeky chocolate snack for breakfast as she needed a 'pick me up' 'Robbie said, "I am really looking forward to joining Gary, Mark and Howard on stage," adding that the final will be shown on 25th February.' The winners of the competition will appear in a West End show which will be loosely based on the lives of a boy band like Take That. Kate asked: 'Was Robbie a guest judge on X Factor? I know he performed on the show.' All change: Kate wore a big smile on her face as she left the studios following her shift Mixing up her look: Kate looked sassy in plaid trousers and a purple padded jacket Off she goes: She soon stuck on a helmet as she prepared to head to her next destination Easy rider: She looked a little unsure as she was driven off Richard replied: 'You're tugging on a thread there. He's done the judge's houses....' 'I think he would be good...' Kate interrupted.' 'Are you listening to what I am saying?' he said. 'Yes, he did judge's houses,' Kate responded. As the interview continued, she pulled an awkward grimace as she clearly felt a little embarrassed. 'Are you listening to what I'm saying?' Richard snapped at Kate Garraway during a segment on the Take That reunion during a very awkward interview on GMB the day before Talking about Robbie Williams, who is set to appear on Let It Shine, Richard told the girls: 'Not only will he be joining his old bandmates for a sing-song, he will be joining them as a guest judge' The Sun previously wrote about the Robbie reunion rumours earlier in the month. Gary Barlow, 46, is said to have masterminding the get-together to boost ratings for his BBC One singing show - but reportedly hadn't bothered asking Jason Orange back. 'Robbie seems very keen to get on board, so things are looking good. But in the end, Gary decided not to even ask Jason,' a source told the paper. 'Robbie said: "I am really looking forward to joining Gary, Mark and Howard on stage," adding that the final will be shown on 25th February' Big show: The winners of the competition will appear in a West End show which will be loosely based on the lives of a boy band like Take That Awkward: When Kate pressed Richard on whether or not Robbie ever did judge's houses on X Factor, he said: 'Are you listening to what I am saying?' Not happy: Kate pulled a grimace afterwards after Richard tried to put her in her place Really not impressed: She gave him daggers after his harsh words All OK again: She was soon laughing once again alongside her co-host Charlotte Hawkins Read more: Share or comment on this article 6
